ACTOR2: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Civilians (Central African Republic); Muslim Group (Central African Republic)
NOTES: African peacekeepers fired into the air to try to disperse a mob bent on hunting down and killing Muslims taking refuge in a church compound. Young men threw rocks and tried to break into the church compound. The mob hurled rocks at the peacekeepers and their vehicles and only dispersed after shots were fired.

ACTOR2: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)
NOTES: Small demonstration against French and MISCA disarmament process. Demonstrators burned tyres and set up road blocks. Congolese soldiers fired shots in the air and used tear gas to disperse protesters.

ACTOR2: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)
NOTES: Christian protesters gathered at the entrance to the airport, demanding the resignation of transitional President Michel Djotodia and the departure of the Chadian elements of MISCA. After being pelted with stones, Chadian soldiers opened fire on the demonstrators, killing one and wounding another.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Muslim Group (Central African Republic); Refugees/IDPs (Central African Republic)
ACTOR2: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)
NOTES: Muslim rioters fired shots and burnt and looted property in the fifth arrondissement of Bangui. Angry tenants displaced at the Bangui Mpoko airport site burnt tyres on the road and ransacked Muslim properties in the attacked neighborhood in retaliation. MISCA troops dispersed the rioters.

ACTOR2: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)
NOTES: Shots heard as MISCA forces disperse a group of Muslims who took set fire to furniture on the road. No casualties reported.

ACTOR2: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)
NOTES: The Muslim communities of Yakite and Sara neighborhoods, Bangui, demonstrated against disarmament operations conducted by French soldiers, which they feel are unfairly biased against Muslims. Demonstrators burned tyres. Protest was dispersed by elements of MISCA.

ACTOR2: Rioters (Central African Republic)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Christian Group (Central African Republic); MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)
SOURCE: RCA (Central African Republic); World Food Programme
NOTES: 8 January 2014, Muslim communities demonstrated against disarmament operations conducted by French soldiers by burning tires and clashing with christian rioters in Yakite, Sara, Kokoro and Fatima neighborhoods, Bangui. They they feel the disarmament is unfairly biased against Muslims. The demonstration was dispersed by elements of MISCA.

ACTOR2: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Civilians (Central African Republic); Muslim Group (Central African Republic)
NOTES: Children looted and set fire to a mosque to avenge the death of a Christian the previous day. MISCA soldiers intervened to interrupt the attack.

ACTOR2: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Military Forces of Rwanda (1994-); Civilians (Central African Republic); Muslim Group (Central African Republic)
NOTES: A mob of thousands looted and burned Muslim homes in PK13, threatening to kill. Rwanda MISCA troops dispersed the group.

ACTOR2: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)
NOTES: Following the event where civilians were beaten by MISCA during questioning, people took to the streets, burned tyres and demanded the departure MISCA, who shot into the air.

ACTOR2: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)
SOURCE: Radio Ndeke Luka; RCA (Central African Republic)
NOTES: Clashes between Chadian elements of MISCA and rioters having erected road barricades in Damara protesting against the Sangaris disarmament of Anti-Balaka. Six people killed and several others injured.

ACTOR2: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Civilians (Chad)
NOTES: Protesters (civilians and Anti-Balaka) erected barricades and burned tyres against the presence of international forces as Chadian soldiers attempted to evacuate a convoy of Chadian nationals. MISCA attempt to remove the barricades. Exchange of fire occurs.

ACTOR1: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)
ACTOR2: Rioters (Central African Republic)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Prisoners (Central African Republic); Anti-Balaka
NOTES: Warning shots fired by MISCA at Ngaragba prison to control a mutiny of prisoners, most of whom are Anti-Balaka. No deaths reported.

ACTOR1: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)
ACTOR2: Rioters (Central African Republic)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Anti-Balaka
NOTES: 30 Cameroonian peacekeepers fired into the air to disperse a group of angry Anti-Balaka who congregated outside the concrete walls of the church compound, threatening to kill Muslims who were sheltering inside. They brought 40 litres of gasoline and threatened to burn the church to the ground.

ACTOR2: Military Forces of France (2012-2017)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)
NOTES: Following the shooting of two civilians and a lieutenant of the gendarmerie by Chadian soldiers of MISCA, angry people erected barricade and burned tyres. French and MISCA soldiers intervened to disperse the rioters.

ACTOR2: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)
NOTES: Thousands took to the streets to protest against the relocation of ex-Seleka to a gendarme school in Kolongo. They barricaded the road and burned tyres. MISCA forces sent to keep the situation under control, resulting in three protesters injured.

ACTOR2: Civilians (Central African Republic)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)
NOTES: Youths, supported by Anti-Balaka, lynched a Muslim when he left his house to look for food. They tried to loot the house of the victim, but were dispersed by MISCA.

ACTOR2: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Military Forces of the Central African Republic (2014-2016) Gendarmerie
NOTES: Students from the University of Bangui went on strike due to the non-payment of scholarships. They erected barricades and burned tyres. MISCA and the gendarmerie dispersed the demonstrators.

ACTOR2: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)
NOTES: Angry residents erected barricades in the streets to protest against recent violence in the Bea Rex area.

ACTOR2: Civilians (Central African Republic)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)
NOTES: A mob attempted to attack a Muslim man as he was tranferring money at a bank. Burundian soldiers of MISCA fired to disperse the crowd, injuring six people including four who were under 16.

ACTOR2: Military Forces of France (2012-2017)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)
NOTES: A group of young Muslims were mobilised by ex-Seleka to throw stones against Sangaris and MISCA. A Central African was killed during this act.

ACTOR2: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Military Forces of France (2012-2017)
NOTES: Anti-government protests held by armed demonstrators who shot at Sangaris troops and tried to force their way into a MISCA base. MISCA responded by returning fire, killing three.

ACTOR2: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Military Forces of France (2012-2017)
NOTES: Anti-Balaka erected barricades on Avenue des Martyrs due to discontent with the arrest of 14 comrades by EUFOR. They were later dispersed by MISCA and Sangaris.

ACTOR2: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)
NOTES: Following the shooting of an Anti-Balaka by MISCA, Anti-Balaka take to the streets, erect barricades, and burn tyres. MISCA fire shots in the air to disperse the militia.

ACTOR2: Military Forces of France (2012-2017)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: EUFOR RCA: European Union Force in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: Anti-Balaka, angered at the recent killing of a comrade, surround the ex-Seleka Camp RDOT. Shots were fired. Sangaris and EUFOR disperse the group.

ACTOR2: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014)
NOTES: While people queued at a bank to collect their wages, they felt angered that the bank clerks were not doing their work properly and for planning to close early. The group smashed the glass door of the bank. This prompted MISCA to react by firing to disperse the crowd. One man was shot in the arm.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of the Central African Republic (2014-2016)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MISCA: African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (2013-2014); EUFOR RCA: European Union Force in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: People burnt down a police vehicle involved in a road accident that left three people killed due to overspeed in Malimaka neighborhood of Bangui. MISCA and EUFOR intervened to disperse the rioters.

ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: A MINUSCA patrol fatally struck a boy who was crossing the road. This caused a crowd to form that attacked the MINUSCA soldiers. They fired into the air to disperse the crowd, but one person was struck by a bullet and killed.

ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Military Forces of France (2012-2017); EUFOR RCA: European Union Force in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: Ex-Seleka demonstrated in Bangui against plans to send them back to their rural homes. They barricaded the roads with pieces of iron, wood and car parts, and were armed. Soldiers of MINUSCA, Sangaris and EUFOR-RCA were deployed to contain the ex-rebel protesters. Shots were fired into the air by both sides.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of the Central African Republic (2016-) Prison Guards
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
ACTOR2: Rioters (Central African Republic)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Prisoners (Central African Republic)
NOTES: After a fellow inmate died from TB, prisoners of Ngaragba prison rioted against the staff. MINUSCA intervened and calmed the situation after dialogue with a representative of the prisoners. One prisoner died during the riot and 13 were injured, while one MINUSCA peacekeeper was seriously wounded, and six others injured.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Anti-Balaka; MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
ACTOR2: Rioters (Central African Republic)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Muslim Group (Central African Republic)
NOTES: Anti-Balaka members protested against the occupation of the Court of Appeals by Muslims, leading to clashes which killed 3 young Muslims and injured 10 others, and killed 2 anti-Balaka and injured 2. International forces fired teargas to disperse the crowds, and cleared the building. The secretary-general of the Bambari young Muslims association says they were fired on by international forces.

ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: A car which was discovered to have weapons in it broke down. Youths starting throwing stones at it and the occupants, which included a former Minister of Trade, before setting the car on fire. MINUSCA forces arrived to save the people on board, and fired tear gas to disperse the crowd.

ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: Following the arrest of 2 suspected criminals who are Muslims in the Bornu 5 area of Bangui, a group of Fulani Muslims asked for their release. MINUSCA forces attempted to intervene to ease tensions. A violent confortation followed leading to 30 injuries, damage to the vehicles of the convoy (broken windows), at least a dozen houses burned and unconfirmed reports of a death.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of the Central African Republic (2014-2016) Prison Guards
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: At least 18 prisoners escaped from a central prison in Ngaragba after taking weapons from the guards. Most of the criminals are suspected to be former members of armed groups. The prison was also protected by international forces.

ACTOR1: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
ACTOR2: Rioters (Central African Republic)
SOURCE: RCA (Central African Republic); Radio Ndeke Luka
NOTES: 3 people were killed and several injured when MINUSCA and Sangaris forces attempted to dismantled barricades in the 3rd and 6th districts of Bangui and were opposed by youths from the areas who had erected them. Residents marched in protest against the move and re-erected the barricades.

ACTOR1: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
ACTOR2: Rioters (Central African Republic)
SOURCE: RCA (Central African Republic); Radio Ndeke Luka
NOTES: 3 people were killed and several injured when MINUSCA and Sangaris forces attempted to dismantled barricades in the 3rd and 6th districts of Bangui and were opposed by youths from the areas who had erected them. Residents marched in protest against the move and re-erected the barricades.

ACTOR2: Military Forces of the Central African Republic (2014-2016) Gendarmerie
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: Protesters erected barricades and gunfire was heard in 8 districts in Bangui after the announcement that former President Francoise Bozize would not be allowed to run in the upcoming elections. Local gendarmes, police and MINUSCA forces moved quickly to dismantle the barricades.

ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
SOURCE: RCA (Central African Republic); AFP; Radio Ndeke Luka
NOTES: A dead city protest strike was observed in Bangui against MINUSCA during which barricades were erected on various roads. At one point MINUSCA peacekeepers deployed alongside national police personnel allegedly used tear gas and aerial firing to disperse some crowds in the Sango neighbourhood, resulting in 4 people killed and 11 others wounded, including 5 peacekeepers. A MINUSCA spokesman said that peacekeepers had not fired on civilians but had intervened to dismantle barricades manned by armed individuals. Gunfire and looting were also reported in other areas of Bangui. A partial dead city protest strike was also observed against MINUSCA in Nzako on the call of civil society groups. Only the cities administration remained closed however.

ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
SOURCE: Reseau des Journalistes pour les Droits de l'Homme
NOTES: Following a car accident, where a girl lost her life, angry inhabitants of Bouar attacked and set on fire a vehicle of MINUSCA. The activities were blocked in the Mamadou-Sara district in the 3rd arrondissement where the accident took place because of the tear gas launched by the UN forces to disperse the demonstrators.

ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: A MINUSCA peacekeeper was injured by a stone thrown by a protester in Bambari. The protesters were angry over insecurity following the recent killing of an individual in the area.

ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
SOURCE: Reseau des Journalistes pour les Droits de l'Homme
NOTES: 50 youth invaded the MINUSCA base to protest the shooting of a young man attempting to climb the military base's wall by a MINUSCA soldier, leaving him wounded. The MINUSCA element thought he was a robber.

ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
SOURCE: Reseau des Journalistes pour les Droits de l'Homme
NOTES: Three Minusca vehicles were burned by a group of protesters who accused the mission's convoys of causing two accidents. Three peacekeepers injured when they intervened.

ACTOR2: Military Forces of the Central African Republic (2016-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: On 10 April, prisoners of Ngaragba's prison in Bangui mutined and clashed with the CAR and MINUSCA security forces deployed in the area the same day: 2 dead and one wounded among the mutineers.

ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
SOURCE: Reseau des Journalistes pour les Droits de l'Homme
NOTES: On 4 May, civil society organisation launched a 'dead city' strike. People built barricades and blocked the circulation, notably in 2nd and 6th neighbourhoods. MINUSMA vehicles were targeted and had make some dissuasion shots.

ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: 07 September. Over 400 protesters gathered outside of the MINUSCA base in Bria carrying the bodies of people killed in the Bria area the day before, to express frustration over the force's failure to protect civilians from the recent attacks by FPRC and Anti-Balaka. MINUSCA reported two grenades being thrown at the base by the protesters, while locals alleged MINUSCA fired tear gas at them.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: FDPC: Democratic Front for the People of the Central African Republic
ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: 17 March 2019. The FDPC reinstalled their barricade along the Bouar-Beloko road near Zoukombo. MINUSCA peacekeepers were deployed to convince the group to remove the blockade. [size=no report]

ACTOR2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
NOTES: On 9 April 2020, residents destroyed a MINUSCA temporary operational base in Beboura 3 (Ouham Pende) after a fatal car accident between patrolling MINUSCA officials and a woman, who died soon after. Witnesses asked officials for immediate compensation. Soon after the angry population set the base on fire and destroyed the facilities. Neither injuries nor fatalities were reported. [size=no report]

ACTOR2: MONUC: United Nations Organization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (1999-2010)
NOTES: Students riot for more UN support in the area. UN and Rebel groups brought in to stop the riots. 1 student shot in the leg.

ACTOR2: MONUC: United Nations Organization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (1999-2010)
NOTES: Riots because MONUC started its campaign and raids titled Bunia Without Arms and it coincided with what the Union des Patriotes Congolais (UPC) considers as its third anniversary

ACTOR2: MONUC: United Nations Organization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (1999-2010)
NOTES: Riots because MONUC started its campaign and raids titled Bunia Without Arms and it coincided with what the Union des Patriotes Congolais (UPC) considers as its third anniversary

ACTOR2: MONUC: United Nations Organization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (1999-2010)
NOTES: 4 MONUC armoured vehicles damaged by angry mob that suspected the peacekeepers of transporting Rwandan nationals in their vehicle.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUC: United Nations Organization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (1999-2010)
ACTOR2: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
NOTES: ELECTION: 'Demonstrators routed national police, opened fire and set a police truck ablaze in the aftermath of the announcement of presidential election results.'

ACTOR2: MONUC: United Nations Organization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (1999-2010)
NOTES: Violent demonstrations against unconfirmed return of the Banyamulenge [Congolese Tutsis]. Kirungu, MONUC military observers and installations targeted and plundered.

ACTOR2: MONUC: United Nations Organization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (1999-2010)
NOTES: 300 displaced persons rioting, attacked MONUC patrol. 1 civilian killed, more than 30 (civilians and MONUC) injured.

ACTOR2: MONUC: United Nations Organization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (1999-2010)
NOTES: Kiwanja, Rutshuru district. Police dispersed several hundred demonstrators against MONUCs inability to stem regional violence. 10 MONUC injured.

ACTOR1: MONUC: United Nations Organization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (1999-2010)
ACTOR2: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
NOTES: FARDC pulled out of the area in line with the January conference ceasefire. Civilians in Rutshuru feared rebels would take over, so they rioted against MONUC soldiers on the evenings of 23 and 24 June. Aid was suspended due to the unrest.

ACTOR1: MONUC: United Nations Organization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (1999-2010)
ACTOR2: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
NOTES: FARDC pulled out of the area in line with the January conference ceasefire. Civilians in Rutshuru feared rebels would take over, so they rioted against MONUC soldiers on the evenings of 23 and 24 June. Aid was suspended due to the unrest.

ACTOR2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: A group of rioters angry over UN presence in the region clash with DRC and UN forces. One protester dead.

ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: Rioters near Goma stone a UN peacekeeping vehicle as they demand the UN security zone to be expanded.

ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: 2 MONUSCO soldiers from Uruguay allegedly killed 2 rioters during a protest in Goma against the UNs inaction in Goma.

ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: Rioters threw stones at MONUSCO vehicles, accusing the peacekeepers of cannibalism.

ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: Rioters threw stones at MONUSCO vehicles, accusing the peacekeepers of cannibalism.

ACTOR2: Civilians (Democratic Republic of Congo)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: Rioters in Bunia seriously injured a MONUSCO soldier during a protest, throwing stones at the peacekeepers vehicle. 4 Congolese civilians injured too.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
SOURCE: Radio Okapi; Depeches de Brazzaville (Republic of Congo)
NOTES: 2 youths who were part of a self-defense brigade were killed when protesters intercepted a joint patrol of FARDC and MONUSCO soldiers near Oicha. The soldiers fired warning shots to disperse the hostile youth armed with machetes, spears and stones. 3 people were then shot by the soldiers, and 2 died.

ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: MONUSCO has claimed that the Tanzanian peacekeepers were attacked by taxi drivers when they attempted to remove a barricade, forcing them to fight them off, leading to 1 of the taxi drivers being killed by a stray bullet, although this was not apparent when they left the scene. A civil society source told AFP that the Tanzanian peacekeepers 'got out of their jeep and fired at close range on a crowd of motorbike riders blocking their passage' killing 1.

ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
NOTES: Angry residents of Manzobe and Idohu armed with knives and stones marched to demand the release of two people imprisoned as suspects in a recent ADF-NALU attack. They attacked the police station to attempt to release the two, then went to the MONUSCO camp in Idohu and threw projectiles at the peacekeepers, who fired into the air to disperse them. 1 person was killed by a stray bullet.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: UDPS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress
NOTES: Clashes occur between demonstrators, who threw stones, and the police during protests against the proposed electoral law. The crowd also attacked two MONUSCO peacekeepers, injuring one. Some demonstrators were wounded and others arrested alongside opposition political leaders, including Rubens Mikindo, federal leader of the Union for Social Progress and Democracy [UDPS] in the east; Christian Badose, Ecide parties spokesman; Leon Tembo, Federal Chairman of the Union for the Congolese Nation [UNC] in the east and Jean Baptiste Kasekwa, Ecide parties executive secretary in eastern DRCongo.

ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: As former South Sudanese rebel fighters were being escorted back to a camp in the Munigi area by MONUSCO peacekeepers after receiving medical treatment, the population of the area blocked the road over their hostility to the fighters being kept in the area and began throwing stones at them before briefly taking some DDR workers hostage. No injuries were reported.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: At least 10 people were injured, including a Congolese police officer and a MONUSCO peacekeeper, during clashes in Kisangani between two groups of young people related to the lynching of a thief over the weekend.

ACTOR2: Civilians (Democratic Republic of Congo)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Government of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019); MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: Representatives of the government and MONUSCO had travelled to Kasenyi to hold workshops promoting peace. An angry crowd attacked the delegation's hotel, injuring 2 officials and damaging MONUSCO vehicles.

ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: Tensions were registered on January 31st in the periphery of Goma between South-Sudanese ex-combatants and MONUSCO forces. The former blocked roads and pelted MONUSCO forces, demanding their departure from a camp where 370 ex-combatants are living. The MONUSCO, in turn, used tear gas on the ex-combatants.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: LUCHA: Fight for Change
NOTES: On March 26, LUCHA militants took to the streets to protest in front of the MONUSCO offices in Goma, before police fired teargas to disperse them. 5 protesters were injured as they forced their way into the MONUSCO offices while the police was firing teargas; a police officer was also injured when he tried to fire teargas. The protesters in case wanted to leave the memorandum, which asked the UN Security Council to vote for a new resolution for its mandate in DRC, vouching to guarantee free and peaceful elections.

ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: 28 April. A MONUSCO patrol was attacked and stoned by at least 700 civilians in the Rwangoma district of Beni city. Several Peacekeepers got injured

ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: 12 May. Rioters stoned a MONUSCO patrol in Boikene.

ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: On May 19, people took to the streets and barricaded the routes between DRC and Burundi to protest the killing of the local chief the night before. Several tires were burned; there were many youth protesting. Some barricades were set in front of MONUSCO, but after the latter engaged in conversation, they were removed.

ACTOR2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-); Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
NOTES: On 25 November 2019, riots took place in Beni against the recent killlings in the region of Beni, North Kivu, by the ADF. Rioters torched the City Hall, some MONUSCO vehicles and vandalized and looted MONUSCO's facilities. Sources give different numbers but at least one police officer and four civilians have been killed. At least 16 civilians, 15 police officers and 5 FARDCs were injured. Around 20 civilians were arrested. [Size=at least 25]

ACTOR2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-); Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
NOTES: On 26 November 2019, riots continue to take place in Beni against the recent killings by the ADF in the region and to request MONUSCO's departure. Barricades were raised and the army, the police and the MONUSCO intervened. A man would have been killed by bullet shot. [Size=unknown]

ACTOR2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-); MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: On 27 December 2020, a group of youths blocked a joint patrol of the FARDC, the police and the MONUSCO, to prevent them from heading to the Rwangoma district of Beni town (Beni, Nord-Kivu). Despite the warning shots in the air fired by the security forces to make a way through, the group confronted them, resulting in an army jeep vandalized and a police motorcycle burned. The security forces arrested 10 people. The youths accused the security forces of inaction and of being complicit in the insecurity in Beni. [size=no report]

ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
SOURCE: Radio Okapi; Bunia Actualite; Twitter; Actualite; MNCTV Congo
NOTES: On 21 March 2021, a group of young people burned car tires and blocked national road number 27 in this area, including a vehicle from an agency of the United Nations, which was coming back from the city in Iga Barriere (Djugu, Ituri), in response to CODECO-FDBC activity at a commercial center in the area. [size=no report]

ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: On 5 April 2021, a group of people blocked traffic along the national route no.27 at the level of Lopa (Djugu, Ituri) to demonstrate against the recrudescence of criminality/insecurity in the area as well as the illegal barriers erected by CODECO militiamen. A passing MONUSCO convoy was targeted with projectiles, who fired shots in response. No injuries and/or fatalities were reported. [size=no report]

ACTOR2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: On 7 April 2021, a group of people in the city of Beni (Beni, Nord-Kivu) attempted to intercept several military vehicles of the MONUSCO that were coming from Kasindi. In response, the FARDC fired shots to disperse the rioters, who were demanding the departure of the MONUSCO in the light of increased ADF attacks in the region. [size=no report]

ACTOR2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: On 7 April 2021, a group of people erected barricades to block the passage of MONUSCO vehicles in Kasindi (Beni, Nord-Kivu). The group was demonstrating to demand the departure of the MONUSCO, who they accuse of mishandling the security situation in the Eastern part of the country. Reports suggest that the FARDC intervened in the demonstration, firing a shot which resulted in the killing of 1 person. [size=no report]

ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: On 9 April 2021, a group of rioters burned two bridges in the neighborhood of Mbimbi in Oicha (Oicha, Beni) to block the passage of MONUSCO vehicles in the area, during a demonstration against the recrudescence of ADF attacks in the region and to demand the departure of the MONUSCO, who they accuse of mishandling the security situation in the Eastern part of the country. Reports suggest that 1 person was killed by MONUSCO and another one was injured. [size=no report]

ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: On 27 April 2021, a group of people barricaded the road to block MONUSCO vehicles in the Benengule neighborhood of Beni (Beni, Nord-Kivu). Shots were reportedly fired, injuring two people. No reason for the demonstration reported. [size=no report]

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Turkish Ethnic Group (Cyprus); Teachers (Cyprus); Journalists (Cyprus); Labour Group (Cyprus); UCN: Unite Cyprus Now; Former Police Forces of Northern Cyprus (2015-2020)
ACTOR2: UNFICYP: United Nations Peacekeeping Force in Cyprus (1964-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Police Forces of Cyprus (2013-)
NOTES: On 9 March 2020, Turkish Cypriot unionists of teachers' and journalists' associations and other labour groups, as well as the bi-communal group Unite Cyprus Now, demonstrated at the Lidras (Lokmaci) crossing in Nicosia against the closure of four crossing points from the South to the North due to the coronavirus. At the same time, plain-clothes and uniformed police of Northern Cyprus pushed about 50 UNFICYP officers back into the buffer zone, following a dispute over area of jurisdiction. UN officers joined the Greek Cypriot police after violent demonstrations in previous weeks. [size=at least 50]

ACTOR2: ECOMIG: Economic Community of West African States Mission in Gambia (2017-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Police Forces of Gambia (2017-)
NOTES: Clashes between Kanilai people and ECOMIG took place when those protested the presence of military forces and the same ECOMIG in the region. ECOMIG soldiers finally opened fire when the situation got more tense. 5 people were wounded and 1 dead. 22 were arrested by police.

ACTOR2: ECOMIG: Economic Community of West African States Mission in Gambia (2017-)
NOTES: Pro-Jammeh supporters burnt tyres on roads at Kanilai to protest the presence of ECOMIG forces. ECOMIG forces opened fire on protesters, leaving at least 1 killed and 9 others injured. Citing the illegal character of the manifestation, 22 people were also arrested.

ACTOR2: ECOMIG: Economic Community of West African States Mission in Gambia (2017-)
NOTES: At Kanilai on 3 June the military could be seen patrolling the streets. Armed youth engaged the police in running battles.

ACTOR2: UNOCI: United Nations Operation in Ivory Coast (2004-)
NOTES: A crowd of angry youths erected barricades across one of the districts main streets, forcing a patrol from the United Nations peacekeeping mission in the country, UNOCI, to turn back.

ACTOR2: UNOCI: United Nations Operation in Ivory Coast (2004-)
NOTES: Supporters of embattled Ivory Coast strongman Laurent Gbagbo on Thursday attacked and burned at least three United Nations vehicles in the main city Abidjan in Youpougon.

ACTOR1: UNIFIL: United Nations Interim Force in Lebanon (1978-)
ACTOR2: Rioters (Lebanon)
NOTES: Two patrols of the United Nations interim force inLebanoncame underattackFriday by residents from separate incidents in the area of Al-Mansouri and Majdal Zoun. In oneattack,a patrol was blocked by a group of men who attempted to harm peacekeepers and damage vehicles. In the other, residents similarly blocked a convoy and attacked the soldiers.

ACTOR2: UNIFIL: United Nations Interim Force in Lebanon (1978-)
NOTES: On 4 August 2018, local residents confronted a patrol from the United Nations Interim Force in Lebanon and burned one of its vehicles in the district of Tyr on the main road between Tyr city and al Naqoura during an altercation prompted by members of the patrol taking pictures of residential houses. [size=no report]

ACTOR2: UNIFIL: United Nations Interim Force in Lebanon (1978-)
NOTES: On 25 July 2019, a clash emerged between townspeople and UNIFIL forces when the latter attempted to enter private property in Blida (Marjayoun) town. The clash resulted in minor damage to a UNIFIL vehicle. [size=no report]

ACTOR2: UNIFIL: United Nations Interim Force in Lebanon (1978-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Military Forces of Lebanon (2020-2021)
NOTES: On February 10, an unarmed clash erupted between members of Hezbollah and a UNIFIL Patrol in Baarachit, in the Bent Jbeil district of Nabatiyeh. The UNIFIL Patrol was accused of taking pictures and entering private neighbourhoods. Women and children hurled rocks at soldiers and military forces arrived and intervened. [size=no report]

ACTOR2: UNIFIL: United Nations Interim Force in Lebanon (1978-)
NOTES: On 25 May 2020, clashes occurred between residents of the Marjayoun town of Blida, and UNIFIL forces after they entered the town without being accompanied by Lebanese Military forces (what residents are used to). UNIFIL soldiers photographed a number of points and when confronted by residents, clashes erupted. Residents then prevented them from leaving the town, and army Intelligence forces arrived to intervene. [size=no report]

ACTOR2: UNMIL: United Nations Mission in Liberia (2003-)
NOTES: One person was killed and three or four others were injured during a riot by 500 former combatants in the Liberian capital Monrovia on Monday, according to Mark Kroeker, the head of the UN international police force in Liberia

NOTES: mob attacks police and UNMIL after robbers attack Tapita

ACTOR2: Military Forces of Liberia (2006-2018) Presidential Guard
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: UNMIL: United Nations Mission in Liberia (2003-)
NOTES: An angry mob armed with sticks and other deadly instruments went to the Executive Mansion, residence of the president of Liberia, to break down a fence which they said was disrupting water flow; they surprised and overpowered the EPS: Executive Protective Service and UNMIL officers on duty

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Liberia (2006-2018)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: UNMIL: United Nations Mission in Liberia (2003-)
SOURCE: New Dawn; Liberian Observer; Liberia News Agency
NOTES: Violent demonstration led to burning and looting of properties and thousands of dollars after the arrest of the murderes of a man for ritualistic purposes. Several security offices, including the Drug Enforcement Agency (DEA) sub-office in Ganta, were looted during the violence. The arrival of police and UNMIL forces did not deter the rioters. A 3-day curfew was imposed on the county. 47 people were arraigned in connection with the riots

ACTOR2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-2020)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Military Forces of France (2012-2017)
NOTES: Demonstraters gathered at the Kidal airport to protest against a visit by the Malian PM; clashes broke out as MINUSMA forces sought to disperse the demonstrators, who threw rocks, with tear gas, leading to at least 7 protesters and 19 police wounded, though none seriously

ACTOR2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-2020)
NOTES: Tuareg protesters said they pushed UN personnel from an airfield, burning generators and tearing down tents. MINUSMA soldiers fired tear gas and warning shots but eventually fled.

ACTOR2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-2020)
NOTES: A huge crowd of youth stormed the MINUSMA headquarters in Gao, throwing stones and molotov cocktails. MINUSMA responded with tear gas and live ammunition, killing three and injuring four. A UN inquiry determined Rwandan policekeeping police used excessive force by opening fire on the crowd.

ACTOR2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-2020)
NOTES: Protesters threw rocks at MINUSMA troops in Kidal, professing opposition to Tuareg involvement in a peace deal.

ACTOR2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-2020)
NOTES: At least two civilians killed and seven wounded when riots broke out at the Kidal airport. Rioters set fires and damaged property in protest of recent arrests by French forces and MINUSMA responded with force.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: CMFPR2: Coordination of Patriotic Movements and Forces for Resistance (CMA)
ACTOR2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-2020)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Military Forces of Mali (2013-2020) Operational Coordination Mechanism
NOTES: On September 10, members of CMFPR2 attempted to force their way in to the MOC camp in Timbutku to claim their participation in joint patrols, the incident triggered an altercation with MINUSMA peacekeepers with warning shots fired and a child was wounded.

ACTOR2: Military Forces of France (2017-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-2020)
NOTES: On September 5, residents in Timbuktu barricaded the main routes preventing traffic access and burned debris, at the airport, demonstrators prevented any movement by French soldiers of Operation Barkhane and MINUSMA peacekeepers, resulting in a standoff. [size=no report]

ACTOR2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-2020)
NOTES: On August 8, villagers in Doundioulou prevented a MINUSMA patrol from entering the village and from exiting their vehicles. [size=no report]

ACTOR2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-2020)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Journalists (International)
NOTES: On August 14, villagers in Diombolo Leye prevented a MINUSMA patrol and three international journalists from carrying out their mission. [size=no report]

ACTOR2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-2020)
NOTES: On August 15, women from the villages of Damakana and Ambassa (coded as Damakana at geoprecision 2) blocked and prevented a MINUSMA patrol from pursuing its mission.[size=no report]

ACTOR2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-2020)
NOTES: On August 19, villagers from Garou-Do and neighbouring villages barricaded a road preventing a MINUSMA patrol access, and threw stick and stones at the patrol, the villagers strongly rejected to establish contact. [size=no report]

ACTOR2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-2020)
SOURCE: Studio Tamani; Nord Sud Journal; AMAP; Maliweb
NOTES: On October 12, residents in Sevare staged a demonstration to denounce foreign military presence, the demonstration degenerated and the demonstrants ransacked, pillaged, and burned MINUSMA storages, at least one truck was also set ablaze.[size=large]

ACTOR2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-2020)
NOTES: On 23 April 2020, a number of women threw stones at a MINUSMA convoy and prevented it from accessing in the village of Sokolo, Danoli Commune (Bandiagara, Mopti). No reason for the action was reported. [size=no report]

ACTOR2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2020-2021)
NOTES: On 2 November 2020, about seventy people demonstrated in front of the MINUSMA camp in Kidal (Kidal, Kidal). The demonstrators chanted anti-France slogans and threw stones before dispersing. No casualties or damages were reported. [size=about 70]

ACTOR2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2020-2021)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Military Forces of France (2017-)
NOTES: On 3 November 2020, a number of demonstrators, primarily male youths, attacked the MINUSMA base in Kidal (Kidal, Kidal). Guard posts and other materiel were set ablaze. The demonstration came in reaction to caricatures of Prophet Muhammad and the discourse of French President Macron on the subject. [size=no report]

ACTOR2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2020-2021)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
NOTES: On 20 January 2021, a number of people demonstrated against French presence by throwing stones against the MINUSMA base in Kidal (Kidal, Kidal). MINUSMA forces fired tear gas and CSMAK (CMA security) intervened to disperse the demonstrators. [size=no report]

ACTOR2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2020-2021)
NOTES: On 22 April 2021, a group of youths shot stones with slingshots against the MINUSMA camp in the town of Kidal (Kidal, Kidal). One peacekeeper was wounded. [size=no report]

ACTOR2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2020-2021)
NOTES: On 29 June 2021, a number of residents demonstrated and barricaded the main road, preventing MINUSMA peacekeepers access in the town of Bankass (Bankass, Mopti). [size=no report]

ACTOR2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2021-)
NOTES: On 14 July 2021, a number of residents demonstrated against MINUSMA in the town of Somadougou (Mopti, Mopti). The hostile crowd prevented the peacekeepers' access. [size=no report]

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: UNAMSIL: United Nations Mission in Sierra Leone (1999-2005)
ACTOR2: UNAMSIL: United Nations Mission in Sierra Leone (1999-2005)
NOTES: Riots in Freetown, UNAMSIL clashes with protesters

ACTOR2: Rioters (Liberia)
NOTES: Liberian refugees riot, attack UN staff over poor conditions in camp

ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Residents of Rusiya neighbourhood (Marka) closed roads and burnt tires in protest against AMISOMs harassment of civilians following a RCIED attack against their convoy a day ago. AMISOM troops arrived at the scene to clear the roads but the unrest turned into an armed clash between the locals and AMISOM forces. It remains unclear whether al Shabaab was involved in the armed clash. AMISOM forces responded with heavy weaponry fire during the clash. Casualties are unknown.

ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Amisom personnel were forced to fire in the air when residents of Hodan district pelted the troops with stones to protest an accident that involved a public vehicle and Amisom armoured vehicle. There no casualties in the incident but a Radio Dalsan reporter confirms damages on business shelters and the minibus.

ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: After a road accident between AMISOM and SNG convoys that claimed the lives of two Somali soldiers, area residents throw rocks at AMISOM soldiers in protest.

ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 12:45EAT, KM4, Mogadishu: the protection detail of a Member of Parliament (MP) opened fire towards protesters, killing two and injuring three. Two civilians were killed and three injured. The reason for the protest is not known. Following the shooting a larger, violent protest occurred. Demonstrators stopped and seized a AMISOM soldier during second protest.

ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A number of demonstrations took place around the city which has led to reported gunfire in the vicinity of KM4. While details from locals remain unclear it is understood the crowd assaulted an AMISOM soldier which resulted in his death after he shot and wounded a demonstrator. The reason of the protest is not known, however, several demonstrations have been occurring following the large-scale hotel attack on 14/10.

ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 07 November. Several residents in Hodan, Mogadishu city protested against AMISOM troops involved in a shooting incident in Heliwa district on 6 November by throwing stones at AMISOM convoys.

ACTOR2: Rioters (South Sudan)

ACTOR2: Civilians (South Sudan)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Refugees/IDPs (South Sudan); UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
NOTES: Shilluk displaced in UNMISS camp in Malakal set fire to homes of other refugees, injuring 6 civilians. Peacekeepers fired warning shots. 2 IDPs detained at the scene.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Refugees/IDPs (South Sudan); Shilluk Ethnic Group (South Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
NOTES: Shilluk displaced in UNMISS camp in Malakal set fire to homes, injured 6 civilians. Peacekeepers fired warning shots. 2 IDPs detained at the scene.

ACTOR2: Civilians (South Sudan)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-); Civilians (International)
NOTES: Four UNMISS staff members (one international, three nationals) were physically assaulted by youth protestors in Bor, following a speech by the local governor.

ACTOR2: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
NOTES: UNMISS used teargas to disperse IDPs who were protesting and threatening aid workers at the UNMISS Tomping site as the new IDP leadership attempted to prevent their relocation to a UN House.

ACTOR2: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
NOTES: Around 100 angry protesters at the Juba IDP camp demonstrated carrying anti-government slogans and destroyed the offices of a humanitarian organisation (ACTED) in the camp, accusing UN officials of stopping them from meeting the US Ambassador during her visit to the camp. UN security guards fired tear gas to disperse the crowd.

ACTOR2: Private Security Forces (South Sudan)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
NOTES: On June 23rd, striking security guards (likely from Insight security, and coded as such) demonstrated at the UN compound in Juba. Some of the demonstrators threw stones at what the source describes as two 'male national UN guards', who were both injured and received medical treatment.[size=100]

ACTOR2: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
NOTES: On September 3rd, IDPs (largely comprising women and children) gathered in the UN PoC site in Juba, in a bid to stop UN Police from arresting men involved in rebel activities. A clash between demonstrators and UN Police was reported, which reportedly led to UN Police withdrawing. [size=hundreds]

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Refugees/IDPs (South Sudan); Nuer Ethnic Group (South Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Police Forces of South Sudan (2011-)
NOTES: On 21 November, two groups of drunken IDP youths clashed in the Bentiu PoC site (Unity state). UNMISS police attempted to separate the clash, prompting the youths to turn on the police. 2 youths were killed (the sources imply they were killed by other youth), and five UNMISS police were injured. [size=no report]

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Refugees/IDPs (South Sudan); Nuer Ethnic Group (South Sudan); Vigilante Group (South Sudan)
ACTOR2: UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
NOTES: On 22 November 2019, IDP youths attacked UN staff, peacekeepers and vehicles at the Bentiu PoC site (Unity state), as the UN were meeting with the family who had lost their relative during the previous days violence. Two UNMISS vehicles were torched, two civilian staff member and a Ghanian peacekeepers were wounded. Youth were dispersed by warning shots after they attacked two guard posts. [size=no report].

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Ethiopia (2018-); Tigray Ethnic Group (Ethiopia); UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
ACTOR2: Rioters (Ethiopia)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Military Forces of Ethiopia (2018-); UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
NOTES: On 22 February 2021, 15 Tigrayan ENDF soldiers from UNMISS engaged in a fist fight with their colleagues at Juba airport (Central Equatoria state), before their flight to Ethiopia. The Tigrayan soldiers were reported to have been concerned at the prospect of returning to Ethiopia, and have been granted asylum in South Sudan with the assistance of UNHCR. [size=at least 15]

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Ruweng Clan Group (South Sudan); Dinka Ethnic Group (South Sudan); Labour Group (South Sudan)
ACTOR2: Civilians (South Sudan)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Aid Workers (South Sudan); UNMISS: United Nations Mission in the Republic of South Sudan (2011-)
SOURCE: Radio Tamazuj; UNOCHA; Catholic Radio Network
NOTES: On 24 April 2021, approximately 50 youth (presumed to be Ruweng Dinka) demonstrated against unemployment at an international NGO compound in Jam Jang in the disputed Ruweng Administrative Area (Pariang county, Unity state). The demonstrators forced their way into the compound and attacked aid workers, wounding several (one seriously). UNMISS peacekeepers intervened, and have increased their presence in Jam Jang. [size=approximately 50]

ACTOR2: Civilians (International)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Aid Workers (International); UNMIS: United Nations Mission in Sudan (2005-2011)
NOTES: 'One INGO international staff working on demining was beaten up in a market in Kadugli due to labor dispute with national workers. UNMIS national guard intervened to get mob to release him. Vehicle confiscated by national authorities.'

NOTES: AU said it killed two civilians in self-defense after a crowd of protesters tried to storm a military base.

ACTOR2: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: A UNAMID soldier was critically wounded in Hamidiya Camp after children pelted him with stones.

ACTOR2: UNISFA: United Nations Interim Security Force for Abyei (2011-)
NOTES: The Ethiopian troops of the United Nations Interim Security Force for Abyei (UNISFA) have contained riots at the area caused by tens of members of Dinka Ngok tribe

ACTOR2: UNISFA: United Nations Interim Security Force for Abyei (2011-)
NOTES: The United Nations Interim Security Force for Abyei (UNISFA) contained the riots staged by some tribesmen at a local market in the disputed area between Sudan and South Sudan

ACTOR2: UNISFA: United Nations Interim Security Force for Abyei (2011-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Misseriya Ethnic Group (Sudan)
NOTES: A UN staff member is accidentally killed as UNISFA tries to control Ngok Dinka demonstrators who attempt to damage the Abyei town mosque as a protest against the decision of the United Nations to host a group of Misseriya who had crossed Abyei rising a number of buses and cars heading towards the mosque the previous night

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: UNAMID: United Nations/African Union Hybrid Operation in Darfur (2007-)
NOTES: Dozens of former UNAMID local staff protested in front of the mission's premises in El-Fasher, Nyala, El Geneina and Zalingei in Darfur, for non-payment of pension entitlements since 2010. UNAMID declared that a majority of the payments had been made while the rest were being finalised, and denounced movement blockades by the protesters affecting UNAMID staffs access to camps and to their workplaces.
